channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel Strikes South of Beirut Amid Push for Cease-Fire in Lebanon
item.description: The conflict between Israel and Hezbollah has intensified in recent days, despite diplomatic efforts to move toward a temporary cease-fire.

item.title: Attack, Withdraw, Return: Israel’s Bloody Cycle of War in North Gaza
item.description: Israel said its forces had returned to northern Gaza to fight a Hamas resurgence. That has brought a new round of suffering for residents.

item.title: Ryanair CEO Michael O’Leary sparks debate after ‘crass’ comments calling for fewer ex-teachers in Irish politics
item.description: O'Leary told Ireland's tourism minister to go back to the classroom as he called for more business people in politics.

item.title: Gen Z and millennial worker productivity is being crushed by bosses who don’t understand them, top economics university research says
item.description: Around a third of Gen Z and millennials report low productivity, and it's their bosses' faults.

item.title: Biden Officials Try to Reassure COP29 Climate Talks
item.description: Negotiators at the COP29 summit in Azerbaijan fear that the return of Donald J. Trump will sap momentum for global climate action.

item.title: Biden Officials Try to Reassure COP29 Climate Talks
item.description: Negotiators at the COP29 summit in Azerbaijan fear that the return of Donald J. Trump will sap momentum for global climate action.

item.title: Gen Z is avoiding university—but it could be the key to landing a hybrid job
item.description: Hybrid work is popular for many reasons. But if having a hybrid job is the goal, shunning university could hurt candidates' chances, ONS found.

item.title: A Republican Trifecta
item.description: With the House, Republicans would have full control of the federal government next year.

item.title: Shell Wins Appeal in Landmark Climate Case in the Netherlands
item.description: A lower court had ordered the company to cut emissions by 45 percent by 2030, but the oil giant argued that a single firm should not be hit with arbit...

item.title: The Who’s Who of Trump’s Staff Picks, and Bitcoin and Stocks Set Records
item.description: Plus, Israel’s cycle of war in North Gaza.

item.title: Man Drives Car Into Crowd in Southern China, Killing at Least 35
item.description: The police in the city of Zhuhai detained a man who they said had driven into people who were exercising at a sports center, state news media reported...

item.title: Trump’s first 2 immigration policy job picks have defended family separation and ramped-up deportations
item.description: Stephen Miller and Thomas Homan portray illegal immigration as a black-and-white issue and applaud Trump’s policy of targeting everyone living in the ...

item.title: German government agrees to February snap election—just weeks after Trump’s inauguration—to restore political stability
item.description: Germany faces a brutal winter election campaign after its three-way coalition government collapsed.

item.title: Hanako Okada Beat the Odds to Upend a Male Political Dynasty in Japan
item.description: Hanako Okada was one of 73 women to win seats at the general election last month, a record number in a Parliament long dominated by men.

item.description: Hanako Okada was one of 73 women to win seats at the general election last month, a record number in a Parliament long dominated by men.
